Is in all Points the fittest Tool,

line_1: Addrest her as a taylor's tool.
line_2: She knew the name. And thus the fool

line_1: 'Tis in the ablest hand a dang'rous tool,
line_2: But never fails to wound the medling fool:

line_1: Nor Lucre's Madman, nor Ambition's Tool,
line_2: Not Fortune's Worshipper, nor Fashion's Fool,

line_1: To think that I will prove a Statesman's tool,
line_2: And live a stranger where I ought to rule?

line_1: His nobler wit becomes the tool
line_2: So loose, so prostitute of soul,

line_2: And oft he put himself to Neptune's School,

line_1: Sometimes he ply'd the strong mechanic Tool,
line_2: Fighting with Winds and Waves on the vext Ocean Pool.

line_1: The lord of nations falls a party's tool.
line_2: While with false lights directing partial rule,

line_1: Who, cursing flatt'ry, is the tool
Who saw his weakness, made their King their tool,
line_2: Then most a slave, when most he seem'd to rule;

line_1: Deaf'ning the ear of Peace: fierce Faction's tool;
line_2: Of rash Sedition born, and mad Misrule;

line_1: " She makes of Victory a pliant tool,
line_2: " Reward of coward — knave, or valiant fool.
